III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff responsibilities
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12207
Section • (3) An agency shall require that social service workers be
Description directly responsible for all the following activities:
• (b) Facilitating services and parenting time for
children for purposes of reunification.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Father reported that foster care worker is preventing reunification.
Father feels the agency has not done anything with the family to
achieve reunification.
Father was interviewed via telephone on April 3, 2024. He
stressed that Bethany Services has lied about him several times in
court and when he tries to defend himself, he is not allowed to
speak. He stated he does not have a chance to speak and when
he does tries to speak, he gets cut off. He stated he has
completed and followed all court orders. He stated he would like
to move his case from Bethany Services because they haven’t
2

done anything to assist him in getting his children back home.
When I asked, did he have any specific ways Bethany Services
did not assist him, he did not identify any specific ways he did not
receive help from the agency. He stated Bethany Services is
trying to terminate his rights. He stated the last time they lied
about him was during a Team Decision Making Meeting (TDM)
that occurred on March 28, 2024, whereby Bethany Services
alleged he was drinking beer during the meeting. He explained
there was an old beer can in the background during the meeting,
but he was not drinking from the beer can. He stated he did not
pay the beer can any attention because he was trying to listen to
what was being said about his case. Father made the statement
that he discussed drinking beer with the DHHS Private Agency
Foster Care (PAFC) Monitor Supervisor and was told drinking
beer was okay on occasions. He said, therefore, on occasions, he
drinks beer. He stated he is currently living with his girlfriend and
the agency has not requested to come to the home to complete a
home study.
PAFC Monitor Supervisor was interviewed via video
conference on April 8, 2024. He stated he was aware of the
Father’s case, and he had spoken to Father on several occasions.
He stated as a matter of fact the Father had gone up the chain of
command speaking with people regarding his case. He stated he
was aware that Bethany Services was asking for permanency for
adoption and wanted to terminate the parental rights due to the
length of time the children had been removed from the home. He
stated the Father was very frustrated with Bethany Services. He
stated what he knows of the case regarding the Father is from
February 8, 2024, when he reviewed the court order. Father had
established housing and was living with his sister temporarily, but
it was not adequate space to bring his three children to the home.
He stated at the time, Bethany Services had not completed a
home study of the home because Bethany Services was not sure
if this was going to be the Father’s permanent location. He stated
he believed Bethany Services was also requesting the Father’s
name be placed on the rental agreement. He said based on his
perspective, the Father did not need to show proof he was on the
rental agreement to show he had adequate space. He stated to
his knowledge Father was attending therapy and was doing drug
screens three times a week. He said the drug screens were
increased to see if he was doing drugs. The PAFC Monitor
Supervisor stated he was not at the TDM on March 28, 2024, so
he did not observe a beer can. He stated Father discussed the
beer can situation with him. He stated Father is very open and
forthcoming with his discussion and answers. He stated
3

historically Father does not have a record of drinking. He said in
his opinion, the children have been removed from the Father’s
care for over two years and this does have an impact on the
children’s return home due to the length of time.
The PAFC Monitor Supervisor stated he looked at Father’s case
and noted Father was following his parenting classes, income was
in compliance, substance abuse was compliant and so was his
therapy attendance. He stated Father was not in compliance with
his housing and sex offender registry. The PACF Monitor
Supervisor said Father has not registered his living location on the
sex offender registry in Michigan.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed on April 8, 2024, via
video conference. She stated Bethany Services top
administrators have sat down with Father and discussed his case.
She stated that Father attends the services provided to him, but
he does not benefit from the services and there is a lack of
progress. She stated Bethany Services has done everything they
could do to work with Father and address his concerns, but he
becomes very argumentative and refuses to listen to reason.
Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) was interviewed on April 8,
2024, via video conference. She stated she was assigned this
case due to its complexity and the last foster care worker leaving
the agency. She stated regarding Father’s court order, he has
completed the majority of the services but there is a lack of benefit
shown from the services he was provided. She stated despite
completing anger management/domestic violence classes Father
continues to have a pattern of domestic violence. She stated he
was arrested/charged with assault multiple times throughout this
case and most recently being 10/2023 which Bethany Services
was just made aware of on 3/27/2024 after a quarterly background
check. She stated Father continues to lack benefit based on his
communication with the agency specifically when he is not in
control of a situation and this behavior has occurred in front of the
children.
The FCS stated Bethany Services has concerns with Father’s
alcohol use which he denies being an issue. She stated after
completing services at a treatment facility, it was
recommended/discussed by the treatment facility that Father
participates in Pathways to Recovery due to him testing positive
for alcohol on drug screens while attending the program. The
FCS said this has not been completed. She stated Father
reported to Bethany Services he has been successfully
4

discharged from the treatment facility and that is what matters.
She stated Father tested positive for alcohol on a couple of drug
screens with Bethany Services as recently as February 2024.
FCS stated Father was observed drinking out of a bud light can, at
the TDM that was completed on March 28, 2024. She stated
Father denied this and stated to her that it was an empty can in
the background.
FCS stated Father needs appropriate housing. He is currently
living with a girlfriend. FCS stated the concern is from a prior
DHHS report concerning Father’s domestic violence. She stated
her concern with this current home with the girlfriend is if this is a
stable home environment given that he is not on the lease and
has no legal authority over the home. She stated the children do
not know this girlfriend or have been around her. FCS stated a
home study of the girlfriend’s home would be completed on April
21, 2024, as her background check/fingerprints has been
completed.
FCS stated Bethany Services provided Father with all necessary
referrals. She stated he was provided documents to verify any
non-compliances such as missed/positive drug screens, court
reports, and documents from service providers. She stated
Bethany Services attempted to assist Father with rent payments
back in December of 2023, but he denied the assistance because
the rent was over three months past due. FCS said the children
were in the process of being returned to Father at that time, but he
did not have stable housing. FCS stated Bethany Services has
continued to provide Family Team Meetings/Team Decision
making Meetings (FTM/TDM’s) any time Father has requested
one to assist him with any needed requests/referrals.
FCS stated Father was in the Parent Partner Program until his
incarceration in October 2022. She stated prior to Father’s
incarceration he received an extension for the services due to her
request. FCS stated she spoke to the Parent Partner during this
time however, Parent Partner stated due to the children being
returned to their mother during the time of August 24, 2022 –
September 5, 2023, the Father’s case could not be re-open as the
plan was no longer reunification with the Father.
FCS said the program is a voluntary program and Father has
been re-referred however, Father has not responded regarding
whether he was interested or not.
5

Documents reviewed:
• Court order dated 4/9/24, states Father is to participate and
show benefit from the following:
- Submit to random drug screen as directed.
- Substance Abuse Assessment and follow
recommendation.
- Substance abuse treatment.
- Psychological evaluation and follow all
recommendations.
- Individual counseling.
- Anger Management counseling.
- Domestic violence education program.
- Parenting class.
- Obtain/maintain appropriate housing and allow
MDHHS access to the residence.
- Obtain/maintain legal source of income and provide
verification to the agency.
- Maintain contact with the agency.
- Sign all releases.
- Parent Partner Program.
• Bethany’s follow-up response to the Court Order dated
4/9/2024 of the Father’s progress per the court order is as
follows:
- Bethany reported Father has completed the majority
of services but there is a lack of benefit shown from
the services he was provided.
- Therapy notes dated November 13, 2023, reported
Father attended 100% of his appointments and was
very timely for each appointment.
- Substance abuse treatment/Drug screen showed a
positive for cocaine on March 27, 2023. His screens
showed a negative for 18 of the 34 screens taken.
On December 6, 2023, and February 21, 2024, his
drug screens was positive for alcohol. He completed
two drug screens at Bethany Services on December
7, 2023, and January 16, 2024, these screens were
negative.
- Employment: Father is employed and has submitted
weekly pay stubs.
- Individual therapy: Father is participating and
attending consistently. Bethany Services reported
they have not seen improvement in conflict.
- Psychological evaluation: Father was referred on
3/4/2022 and the evaluation was completed on
5/11/2022.
6

- Anger management/Domestic violence: Father
completed conflict resolution on March 24, 2022,
and July 15, 2022.
- Parenting classes were completed on February 23,
2023.
- Parent Partner Program: Father was terminated due
to a lack of participation due to being incarcerated.
He has since been re-referred.
• Review of the children’s placement in MISACWIS USP
dated 12/14/23 – 3/12/24.Youth A is currently placed in a
Juvenile Guardianship Home with relative/cousin. She was
removed due to her extensive medical issues. Youth B is
placed with unlicensed relative. Youth C is placed with
unlicensed relative.
• Visitation plan:
Father has parenting time/supervised visits weekly for 2
hours which he attends. Bethany Services supervises all
visits and offers parenting tools and redirection when
needed during the visits. Bethany Services also provides
Father with gas cards for services including parenting time
and medical appointments. The agency foster care worker
is visiting the foster homes of the children monthly. These
visits are documented under the social work contacts in
MiSACWIS.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance. Based on interviews,
documentation on Updated Service plans, agency court report
documentation Bethany Services has provided services to the
Father by way of Family Team Meetings, Team Decision Making
meetings when the father requests a meeting to provide him with
updated information with his case. It is noted that Father
completed the majority of the services that was requested in the
court order.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
